description:
In the past recent years, the Python programming language became popular
and widely used in many science areas, that you can notes from huge
amount of high quality **scientific** libraries available in GitHub.
Python has already won the confidence in neuro-imaging community

Analysis of different **neuroimaging** modalities consists of
identifying such a complex pipeline that include supporting specific
**MRI** data acquisition, image processing, statistics and predictive
modeling, and visualization of the results. **Nilearn** is a Python
package designed to face these challenges. It provides state-of-the-art
**machine-learning** methods for analysis task fMRI, resting-state, or
anathomical data. In my talk, I would like to present general purpose of
Nilearn, focusing on **functional connectivity** and **connectome**
analysis in resting-state fMRI.
title: Explore the brain with Nilearn
